description.narrative: Strengthening Partners Capacity aims to build a partnership with the selected partners by assisting in capacity building of the staff and the organisation. Partners’ institutional capacity is seen as a central issue and a field where Diakonia can provide added value by facilitating organisational analyses and initiatives to strengthen partners’ capacity, either by individual projects aimed at strengthening one or more components, or by bringing partners together. To this end, Diakonia undertake regular capacity building training, workshops and seminars for partners. Diakonia organise and open space for sharing and learning between partners. The past results show those who are more experienced in one area have become resource persons for training and capacity building for those partners who are less experienced. Many Diakonia existing partners have the capacity to undertake work in the thematic areas but need improvement in cross-cutting issues. Based on partner capacity assessment in 2015, there is a need to strengthen partner’s organisational capacity in the area of; strategy planning, protection systems, internal democracy, human resources/finances and physical resources, planning/monitoring and evaluation, advocacy, gender mainstreaming and creating relationships with donors. Diakonia expects for 6 results; 1. Partners’ administrative and finance capacity has been strengthened 2. Partners’ internal democracy has improved 3. Partner’s thematic and methodological capacity has been strengthened 4. Partners’ gender mainstreaming in their organizations, programmes and projects has improved 5. Partners’ capacity to mainstream environment, conflict and in their work (when relevant) has improved and 6. Partners’ external communication capacity has improved.

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity
